com.camerontec.catalys.server.management

Class JMXManagementService

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.camerontec.catalys.util.configuration.AbstractConfigurable
      • com.camerontec.catalys.server.component.ComponentHelper
        • com.camerontec.catalys.server.management.JMXManagementService
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    IComponent, IHasAttributes, IConfigurable, IRegisterable, IService

    public class JMXManagementService
extends ComponentHelper
implements IService
    This service is in charge of exposing the JMX management interface of the Catalys Server to the LMA.
    Please refer to the documentation of methods openComponent() and setComponentActive(boolean) for details on the implementation of this service.

    • Field Detail

      • ATTRIBUTE_ENABLED

        public static final String ATTRIBUTE_ENABLED
        This configuration attribute is used to disable the JMX management service. The value of this attribute must be a boolean. If set to false, the JMX management service will not be activated. When omitted, the value of this attribute defaults to true.

      • DEFAULT_ENABLED

        public static final String DEFAULT_ENABLED

      • ATTRIBUTE_JMX_SERVICE_URL

        public static final String ATTRIBUTE_JMX_SERVICE_URL
        This configuration attribute is used to instruct the JMX management service to use a particular JMX URL to expose its management interface to the LMA.
        This URL should be a well-formed JMX URL specifying a JMX protocol and a port number.
        If the value specified for this attribute is not a well-formed JMX URL, an error will be printed in the logs and the service will not be initialized, which will prevent the application from starting.
        Likewise, should an error occur while attempting to create a connector server listening on the given JMX URL (for example because the protocol specified in the URL is not available in the current JMX implementation, or because the port is already in use), an error will be printed in the logs and the service will not be initialized.

      • DEFAULT_JMX_URL

        public static final String DEFAULT_JMX_URL
        This is the default JMXMP URL (without the trailing port number) used by the service.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • ATTRIBUTE_JMXMP_PORT_RANGE_START

        public static final String ATTRIBUTE_JMXMP_PORT_RANGE_START
        This configuration attribute is used to instruct the JMX management service to use a port range when randomly assigning a port number to its JMXMP connector server.
        This attribute is only taken into account when attribute ATTRIBUTE_JMX_SERVICE_URL is not used.
        This attribute's value must be a positive integer, and it must be less than the value of attribute ATTRIBUTE_JMXMP_PORT_RANGE_END.
        If any of these constraints is not fulfilled, an error will be printed in the logs and the service will not be initialized, which will prevent the application from starting.

      • DEFAULT_PORT_RANGE_START

        public static final int DEFAULT_PORT_RANGE_START
        This is the lower bound of the default port range used to scan for a free TCP port.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • ATTRIBUTE_JMXMP_PORT_RANGE_END

        public static final String ATTRIBUTE_JMXMP_PORT_RANGE_END
        This configuration attribute is used to instruct the JMX management service to use a port range when randomly assigning a port number to its JMXMP connector server.
        This attribute is only taken into account when attribute ATTRIBUTE_JMX_SERVICE_URL is not used.
        This attribute's value must be a positive integer, and it must be greater than the value of attribute ATTRIBUTE_JMXMP_PORT_RANGE_START.
        If any of these constraints is not fulfilled, an error will be printed in the logs and the service will not be initialized, which will prevent the application from starting.

      • DEFAULT_PORT_RANGE_END

        public static final int DEFAULT_PORT_RANGE_END
        This is the upper bound of the default port range used to scan for a free TCP port.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • ATTRIBUTE_LMA_JMX_SERVICE_URL

        public static final String ATTRIBUTE_LMA_JMX_SERVICE_URL
        This configuration attribute is used to instruct the JMX management service to use a particular JMX URL to establish a connection with the LMA. This attribute should only be used in situations where the LMA is using non-standard settings.
        This URL should be a well-formed JMX URL specifying a JMX protocol and a port number.
        If the value specified for this attribute is not a well-formed JMX URL, an error will be printed in the logs and the service will not be initialized, which will prevent the application from starting.
        Likewise, should an error occur while attempting to create a client connection to the given JMX URL, an error will be printed in the logs and the service will not be initialized.

      • DEFAULT_LMA_SERVICE_URL

        public static final String DEFAULT_LMA_SERVICE_URL
        The default JMX service URL of the LMA.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • ATTRIBUTE_STARTUP_SCRIPT_LOCATION

        public static final String ATTRIBUTE_STARTUP_SCRIPT_LOCATION
        This configuration attribute is used to specify the location of the current Catalys Server instance's start-up script. This location is handed over to the LMA during the registration process, so that the LMA can later restart this instance.
        This is one of the two methods which can be used to specify the location of the start-up script. The other method consists in specifying the -DJMXManagementService.startupScript system property when starting the JVM.
        When the two methods are used simultaneously, the latter takes the precedence. Using a system property is the recommended method because it is easy to generate its value dynamically in a shell or bat script, whereas using a configuration property is less portable.
        See Also:
        SYSTEM_PROPERTY_STARTUP_SCRIPT_LOCATION

      • SYSTEM_PROPERTY_STARTUP_SCRIPT_LOCATION

        public static final String SYSTEM_PROPERTY_STARTUP_SCRIPT_LOCATION
        This system property is used to specify the location of the current Catalys Server instance's start-up script. This location is handed over to the LMA during the registration process, so that the LMA can later restart this instance.
        This is one of the two methods which can be used to specify the location of the start-up script. The other method consists in specifying the applicationStartupScript in the configuration of this service.
        When the two methods are used simultaneously, the system property takes the precedence. Using a system property is the recommended method because it is easy to generate its value dynamically in a shell or bat script, whereas using a configuration property is less portable.
        See Also:
        ATTRIBUTE_STARTUP_SCRIPT_LOCATION

      • ATTRIBUTE_STARTUP_SCRIPT_ARGUMENTS

        public static final String ATTRIBUTE_STARTUP_SCRIPT_ARGUMENTS
        This configuration attribute is used to specify the arguments passed into the current Catalys Server instance's start-up script. These arguments are handed over to the LMA during the registration process, so that they are passed into the startup-script when restarting this instance. This is one of the two methods which can be used to specify the arguments of the start-up script. The other method consists in specifying the -DJMXManagementService.startupScriptArguments system property when starting the JVM.
        When the two methods are used simultaneously, the latter takes the precedence. Using a system property is the recommended method because it is easy to generate its value dynamically in a shell or bat script, whereas using a configuration property is less portable.
        See Also:
        ATTRIBUTE_STARTUP_SCRIPT_LOCATION, SYSTEM_PROPERTY_STARTUP_SCRIPT_ARGUMENTS, Constant Field Values

      • SYSTEM_PROPERTY_STARTUP_SCRIPT_ARGUMENTS

        public static final String SYSTEM_PROPERTY_STARTUP_SCRIPT_ARGUMENTS
        This system property is used to specify the arguments of the current Catalys Server instance's start-up script. These arguments are handed over to the LMA during the registration process, so that they are passed into the startup-script when restarting this instance.
        This is one of the two methods which can be used to specify the arguments of the start-up script. The other method consists in specifying the applicationStartupScriptArgs in the configuration of this service.
        When the two methods are used simultaneously, the system property takes the precedence. Using a system property is the recommended method because it is easy to generate its value dynamically in a shell or bat script, whereas using a configuration property is less portable.
        See Also:
        SYSTEM_PROPERTY_STARTUP_SCRIPT_LOCATION, ATTRIBUTE_STARTUP_SCRIPT_ARGUMENTS

      • ATTRIBUTE_ALWAYS_KEEP_JMX_CONNECTOR_SERVER_RUNNING

        public static final String ATTRIBUTE_ALWAYS_KEEP_JMX_CONNECTOR_SERVER_RUNNING
        This configuration attribute is used to instruct the JMX management service to always keep its JMX connector server running between two consecutive attempts to register with the LMA. The default behaviour is to do the opposite, i.e. start a JMX connector server just before trying to register with the LMA and stop it immediately if the registration fails. This is to avoid consuming resources when no one is ever going to make use of the JMX connector server.
        There are situations, however, where it may be desirable to expose MBeans to remote applications that do not wish to go through the LMA to access these MBeans. In such cases, we need to ensure that there is always a JMX connector server running within the application.

      • DEFAULT_ALWAYS_KEEP_JMX_CONNECTOR_SERVER_RUNNING

        public static final String DEFAULT_ALWAYS_KEEP_JMX_CONNECTOR_SERVER_RUNNING

      • ATTRIBUTE_REGISTER_CONFIGURATION_MBEANS_ON_ACTIVATION

        public static final String ATTRIBUTE_REGISTER_CONFIGURATION_MBEANS_ON_ACTIVATION
        This configuration attribute is used to instruct the JMX management service to always register configuration MBeans when activated. The default is 'false', i.e. the MBeans are registered when a connection to the LMA is established.

      • DEFAULT_REGISTER_CONFIGURATION_MBEANS_ON_ACTIVATION

        public static final String DEFAULT_REGISTER_CONFIGURATION_MBEANS_ON_ACTIVATION

      • ATTRIBUTE_REGISTER_RUNTIME_MBEANS_ON_ACTIVATION

        public static final String ATTRIBUTE_REGISTER_RUNTIME_MBEANS_ON_ACTIVATION
        This configuration attribute is used to instruct the JMX management service to always register runtime MBeans when activated. The default is 'false', i.e. the MBeans are registered when a connection to the LMA is established.

      • DEFAULT_REGISTER_RUNTIME_MBEANS_ON_ACTIVATION

        public static final String DEFAULT_REGISTER_RUNTIME_MBEANS_ON_ACTIVATION

      • ATTRIBUTE_NOTIFICATION_DELAY_AFTER_REGISTRATION

        public static final String ATTRIBUTE_NOTIFICATION_DELAY_AFTER_REGISTRATION

      • DEFAULT_NOTIFICATION_DELAY_AFTER_REGISTRATION

        public static final long DEFAULT_NOTIFICATION_DELAY_AFTER_REGISTRATION

      • ATTRIBUTE_GET_PID_COMMAND

        public static final String ATTRIBUTE_GET_PID_COMMAND
        This configuration attribute is used to specify the external command to run to retrieve the current JVM's PID in order to pass it on to the LMA during registration. This enables the LMA to expose attributes and operations for manipulating this application's process (testing whether the process is alive, killing the process, etc.).
        If this configuration attribute is not specified, the default behaviour is as follows:
        • On Unix, a default command is used: ps -o ppid= -p $$
        • On Windows, no default command is available, and the actual result depends on the JVM in use:
          • If the JVM is a Sun 1.6+ JVM, the current PID is retrieved using some undocumented feature of the JVM (that happens to expose its PID in the name of an MXBean).
          • On other JVM types, the JVM's PID simply cannot be retrieved.
        When this attribute is used to specify a command, it is required that this command behaves as follows:
        • The command's exit value should be zero.
        • The command's standard output should contain only one line which is considered to be the PID.
        • The command's error output should be empty.
        If the given command does not comply with any of the above rules, the first attempt to retrieve the PID is considered to have failed, and a second attempt is made as if this command had not been specified, as described above.

        Failure to retrieve the JVM's PID and to pass it on to the LMA is not necessarily a problem, except if the application runs in HA mode, in which case this service will prevent the application from starting if this happens.

      • CATALYS_SERVER_APPLICATION_TYPE

        public static final String CATALYS_SERVER_APPLICATION_TYPE
        The application type used to register the Catalys Server with the LMA.

      • setComponentActive

        public boolean setComponentActive(boolean active)
                           throws Exception
        Activates or deactivates the JMX management service.
        Activation is as follows:
        1. Makes sure that there is not already another JMX management service which is active in the Catalys Server. If this is the case, does not proceed with the activation.
        2. Makes sure that the service has not been explicitly disabled in the configuration. If this is the case, does not proceed with the activation.
        3. Creates an MBean server.
        4. Initializes the LMA Connector, which will initiate the registration with the LMA.
        Deactivation is as follows:
        1. Shuts down the LMA Connector
        2. Releases the MBean server
        Specified by:
        setComponentActive in interface IComponent
        Overrides:
        setComponentActive in class ComponentHelper
        Parameters:
        active - New active state.
        Returns:
        Previous active state.
        Throws:
        Exception - Never.
        See Also:
        ComponentHelper.setComponentActive(boolean)

      • registerHighPerformanceLogging

        public void registerHighPerformanceLogging(HighPerformanceLoggerFactory factory)
                                    throws JMException
        Manually register high performance logging if not already registered.

        If high performance logging is already registered this method has no effect.

        Parameters:
        factory - The high performance logging factory. May not be null.
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - If the supplied factory is null.
        IllegalStateException - If called before this service is activated.
        JMException - On error registering high performance logging.

      • deregisterHighPerformanceLogging

        public void deregisterHighPerformanceLogging()
        Manually deregister high performance logging if not already registered.

        If high performance logging is not registered this method has no effect.

        Throws:
        IllegalStateException - If called before this service is activated.
